topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces Fareed Mosavat, highlights his roles across Reforge, Slack, Instacart, Zynga, Runkeeper, and Pixar, and sets up the episode’s focus on becoming a great PM and expanding scope.

topics.title: Sponsor Break: Coda and Amplitude
topics.summary: Lenny shares a sponsor message about Coda’s all-in-one docs and templates, followed by a short conversation with Amplitude’s John Cutler about expanding from analytics into experimentation and CDP.

topics.title: Fareed’s career overview across companies
topics.summary: Fareed summarizes his path: Reforge leadership, Slack lifecycle/growth, Instacart growth, Runkeeper, Zynga, and starting as an engineer—framing a non-linear career driven by interesting problems.

topics.title: Pixar years and product mindset roots
topics.summary: Fareed shares his Pixar credits and explains how working at the intersection of creative, technical, and storytelling problems shaped his interest in product management.

topics.title: Key Pixar lesson: outcomes over realism
topics.summary: Fareed explains that Pixar taught him to optimize for the audience’s experience and emotion, not technical purity—an analogy he applies to product strategy, UX, and content design.

topics.title: What a Chief Development Officer does at Reforge
topics.summary: Fareed describes Reforge as a blended product/content/cohort experience and outlines his scope: content production, program experiences, partner experts, and operations that deliver member outcomes.

topics.title: Reforge scale and programs today
topics.summary: Fareed shares Reforge’s size and reach: ~150 employees, 19 cohort programs, 10k+ active members, and a broad network of executives-in-residence and expert partners.

topics.title: Why becoming a better PM is hard
topics.summary: Fareed argues PM skill is largely “specific knowledge” learned by doing real work; breaking into PM is non-linear, and training can only accelerate learning loops—not replace real product reps.

topics.title: PM growth loop: execute, generalize, communicate, scale
topics.summary: Fareed lays out a progression loop: ship real work, extract transferable lessons, communicate insights, and earn broader scope with more unknowns—repeating as you level up.

topics.title: Sponsorship, trust, and creating bigger opportunities
topics.summary: Fareed distinguishes sponsorship from mentorship and explains how trust is built through impact, teaching the org, working on top priorities, and “two levels up/down” curiosity across the business.

topics.title: Sponsor Break: Vanta (SOC 2 compliance)
topics.summary: Lenny explains why SOC 2 matters for trust and enterprise sales and promotes Vanta as a way to automate and speed up compliance work, with a listener discount.

topics.title: The Product Leader Canyon and manager death spiral
topics.summary: Fareed introduces the IC-to-manager transition pitfalls: keeping the best work for yourself, becoming a bottleneck, and failing to scale others—requiring a shift from doer to editor/coach and resource marshal.

topics.title: Four types of product work for leaders
topics.summary: Fareed outlines a portfolio view of product leadership: feature work, growth work, product-market-fit expansion (new segments or new products), and scaling work (technical plus trust/safety).
